item.title: Help With Xp Rates! No clue what to do! D:
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Ah, you’ve given one int parameter with rareDrops(i). For this method, you must include a client instance with it, would look something like rareDrops(c, i), but not exactly. Whatever the client class is instanced as.

Read full topic
item.source: Help With Xp Rates! No clue what to do! D:

item.title: Help With Xp Rates! No clue what to do! D:
item.dc:creator: @WayneRsps WayneRsps
item.description:
@WayneRsps wrote:

Here it is, and thanks for the tip. Still learning.

[code]public boolean rareDrops(Client c, int i) {
int rarity = 0;
int TotalDropRates = 0;
int npcDropRate = ((Integer)NPCDrops.dropRarity.get(Integer.valueOf(npcs[i].npcType))).intValue();

    /**
     * Drop rates for different difficulties :D
     * by King Fox
     */
    if (npcDropRate-3 > 0) {
       switch (c.getPA().Difficulty) {
       case 0: // Easy
           TotalDropRates = 1+Misc.random(2);
           c.sendMessage("Rare Drop Rate: "+TotalDropRates+"%");
           break;
       case 1: // Normal
           TotalDropRates = 2+Misc.random(2);
           c.sendMessage("Rare Drop Rate: "+TotalDropRates+"%");
           break;
       case 2: // Hard
           TotalDropRates = 4+Misc.random(2);
           c.sendMessage("Rare Drop Rate: "+TotalDropRates+"%");
           break;
       case 3: // Extreme
           TotalDropRates = 6+Misc.random(2);
           c.sendMessage("Rare Drop Rate: "+TotalDropRates+"%");
           break;
       case 4: // Legend
           TotalDropRates = 14+Misc.random(2);
            c.sendMessage("Rare Drop Rate: "+TotalDropRates+"%");
           break;
       }
   }
   rarity = Misc.random(npcDropRate-TotalDropRates);
     
   return rarity == 0;
}[/code]

Read full topic
